meanings.definition: Give official permission or approval for (an action)
meanings.sent1: The teacher was sanctioning the students' field trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The city council will be sanctioning the new construction project next week.
meanings.sent3: The mayor was sanctioning the squirrel parade through the park.
meanings.sent4: The principal was sanctioning the students' creativity to shine in the art competition.
meanings.sent5: The president was sanctioning the peace treaty to end the conflict.

meanings.definition: Impose a penalty on (someone) for disobeying a rule or law
meanings.sent1: The referee was sanctioning the player for a foul during the game.
meanings.sent2: The court will be sanctioning the company for violating environmental regulations.
meanings.sent3: The judge was sanctioning the cat for stealing the fish from the market.
meanings.sent4: The coach was sanctioning the team for not following the training schedule.
meanings.sent5: The principal was sanctioning the students for cheating on the exam.
